metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4167 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The L3-agent in OpenStack Neutron before 2013.2.4, 2014.x before 2014.1.2, and Juno before Juno-2 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (IPv4 address attachment outage) by attaching an IPv6 private subnet to a L3 router.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-dhcp-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-l3-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-lbaas-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-metadata-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-metering-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-bigswitch - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-bigswitch-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-brocade - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-cisco - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-hyperv - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-ibm - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-ibm-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-metaplugin - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-metering-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-midonet - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-mlnx - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-mlnx-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-nec - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-nec-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-nicira - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-oneconvergence - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-oneconvergence-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-openflow-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-openvswitch - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-plumgrid - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-ryu - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3
neutron-plugin-ryu-agent - 1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3

No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1-0ubuntu1.3').
